item.title: Avarrocka II - BETA TOMORROW
item.dc:creator: @IYAOYAS IYAOYAS
item.description:
@IYAOYAS wrote:

I see what you are saying man. We are on a pretty tight deadline that Artem isn’t being very flexible with so considering what I said in my last post I decided “yolo” and went with a pre-existing base that could provide the people who have been waiting on this project for some time with some entertainment so I can have time to write a purpose built base that can suit not only the developers needs but the needs of the community. You can be sure that we will provide updates to our temporary base as frequent as humanly possible for the most enjoyable experience around.

I kind of did some need for speed programming last night and a good portion of today lol. I added experimental logic statements and local variable initialization to AvarrockaScript.

[CODE]
[#

A simple “Hello World!”/“Goodbye World!” logic testing script.

#]

whether or not we have printed “Hello World!” to the command line

bool saidHello = false

[#

“Hello World!”/“Goodbye World!” logic testing block.

#]
test_block: {

# a logic statement in AvarrockaScript...
if (saidHello):

    # print our goodbye message to the cmd
    println("Goodbye world!")

    # halt the script
    end

# print "Hello World!" to the command line
println("Hello World!")

# assign the value of saidHello to true
saidHello = true

# execute this block again to test the logic
goto test_block

}[/CODE]

I understand that this is not the best use of a logic statement in any way shape or form! I just wrote that as a test to see if the script would actually execute and sure enough… it did. The only thing is that I didn’t actually take the time to write a good platform for logic type statements so I’ll have to back track and redo some things in the near future.

Read full topic

item.title: Avarrocka II - BETA TOMORROW

item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

very well then. i do hope you are able to portray yourself as less of an arrogant prick (not calling you one, but sometimes you come off as one when shit gets heated) and you can stay calm and professional and take this far.

i never meant to cause problems on this topic, just think it’s a highly unprofessional and idiotic decision to settle for x, when you can make y. you know?

Read full topic

item.title: Avarrocka II - BETA TOMORROW
item.dc:creator: @IYAOYAS IYAOYAS
item.description:
@IYAOYAS wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:286, topic:536439”]I wasn’t telling you - you should write one. I’m asking you. why is this worth your time? if you have the knowledge to create a base much more efficient from ground up, rather than reworking someone else’s shitcode.

you could be doing better, and actually making a name for yourself. but you would rather sit back and pace yourself along to a poorly designed server and “rework” and “improve” it.[/quote]

Ah now I see the roots of our misunderstanding. I got involved in RuneScape and MapleStory emulator development because I wanted to remind myself of back in the good 'ol days where I had less responsibilities and could actually have fun every now and again. I’m 25 years old and quite frankly I’m not out to impress anybody or make a name for myself in RSPS, I’m out to have some fun. I’ve already got my degree and been in the field for some time so it’s not like I’m artem who is just getting started with this kind of stuff because my name is already out there. As for the base I don’t really care what base gets used or whether or not I have to develop from the ground up because it is all the same to me.

Pretty much the moral of the story is: I’m not competing with anybody, measuring dicks, or trying to shine in the face of the developers of MoparScape, RuneLocus, or Rune-Server. This is all purely for the sake of having fun on a game I enjoyed years ago.

Please don’t take any of this as if I am being defensive, condescending, or egotistical either (it’s hard to convey things like body language and tone of voice on the internet…). I hope that settled our differences.

Read full topic
